course.subject: DASC
course.name: Applied Linear Algebra for Data Analytics in Science
course.description: This course is an introduction to linear algebra with applications in least square optimization. Topics include vectors, matrices, and eigenproblems. These ideas will be applied to different applications including data fitting, machine learning, pattern recognition, and finance, etc. Numerical computation is used throughout the course as a learning tool. No previous knowledge of linear algebra is assumed.
course.prerequisites: (MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024) AND (COMP 1021 OR COMP 1029P)
